list_definition.definition: (a book etc giving) directions, eg about the use of a machine etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Could I look at the instructions, please?
You must learn to obey instructions.

list_definition.definition: the act of instructing (especially in a school subject or a skill) or the process of being instructed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She sometimes gives instruction in gymnastics.

list_ex_of_english: They were given instructions and practice in the memory task, and no mention was made of there being any subsequent test of grammar learning.
As a result, candidates are less interested in committing themselves to a faction and have less motive to follow the faction leaders' instructions.
The instructions did not provide much more detail than this.
We want to emit instructions by name and to have the assembler make sure the types and values of the operands are sensible.
Assembly language is a textual representation of instructions.
The expansion of vague plan steps into more detailed instructions (methods) at run-time reduces the amount of planning uncertainty, and thus largely simpli®es planning.
The assay was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
As suggested by the finding of an input effect regarding acquisition per se, it is unlikely that the two-year-olds ignored the instructions altogether.
